185519134.review:
All of the things I've talked about in my original BioShock 1 review still hold true in BioShock 2: the themes are poignant, the voice acting is still top-notch, and this version is still a cash grab (when it was initially released). 

However, 2 does something incredible: it's a good sequel to a game that should have never received a direct sequel.

For starters, and perhaps the most important part, it nails the "vibe". Sofia Lamb is the pseudo-Communist counterpart to Andrew Ryan, but frankly, never quite reaches Ryan's heights as an antagonist. She's fine, but the performance is a little one-note. In the original, you could hear Andrew Ryan get angry, start to break, keep it cool, and most of all, stay condescending no matter the emotion. In this, Sofia Lamb keeps stays sophisticated and unmoved in every interaction. She's just a bit dull in comparison. 

But where she lacks, the rest is just as good as the original, and in some ways better. 

The motivation of the player, Subject Delta, is just better all around. You awake to a 1968 Rapture that has been re-opened by the same types of thinkers that populated it originally in the 1940s, and we're having the same problems. Your "daughter" has been taken, and you want her back; simple premise and one immediately more relatable than an assassination attempt at a baseline.

The actual story is pretty simple: The Thinkers Thought Too Much about Humanity and what They believe is best, which in turn lead to more civil wars and butchered (or, drugged and altered) citizens. Only this time we're not dealing with a libertarian capitalist whose sole driving force was to create a place free of government interference, and instead dealing with a slightly more classic villain wanting to unite all people and do what is best for the "good of humanity" no matter the cost. You could draw parallels to communism, but as far as we know her ideals have nothing to do with the economy and almost entirely to do with her collectivist beliefs. Antithetical to Ryan, but remember: she chose to come to Rapture.

Where Sofia Lamb is just fine, the other characters really sell the story. Sinclair is a great, sketchy conman-turned-ally and tragic friend; Eleanor begets a fantastic final act; the new minor villains (Grace, Stanley, Gilbert, etc.) steal the show and offer great questions of morality; and you yourself are an actual, original Big Daddy complete with the best melee weapon of all time: a drill.

While the plot is just fine and the story nails the feeling of what one would come to expect of a BioShock game, what it does to separate itself from the original is what truly lifts the game to its rightful place in the dormant franchise: the excellent gameplay. 

Right off the bat, we're now a dual-wielding psychopath ready to shock and drill our way through the never before seen, fantastic sections of Rapture. The gameplay--while a little clunky on mouse and keyboard due to having no radial wheel--really sings when you're able to blast a rank 3 Incinerate while unloading an entire clip of rocket-propelled spears into a dozen splicers. 

While the combat cadence can be a bit too frenetic and frequent at times--enemy placements and an excess of ammo and looting can infrequently kill the pace--it's never dull. Having to now escort a Little Sister as the proclaimed Daddy to "angels" and guard them as they gather ADAM was a true highlight, and preparing areas with an insane amount of traps and revving my drill to dash at any stragglers always felt incredible. 

Other gameplay tweaks are much welcomes, too. Hacking is now in-universe instead of a separate screen and is quick and easy; security Bots can be randomly named, upgraded, and repaired while offering supporting fire; the range of plasmids are familiar but now have upgrades that enhance more than just the damage, while the newcomers are unique if niche; the weapons are miles better than the original game both in terms of gunplay and creative ammo choices; and so on. The original holds up extremely well gameplay wise, and this game even moreso.

Other tweaks and additions that I enjoy are the new enemies, both visual upgrades to regular splicers (who are most hideous than ever) and the new Big Daddies/Sisters. The new Big Daddies--especially the Alpha series in their aggression and speed--offer more fun encounters, and the Big Sisters are not only intense fights with excellent sound designs, but the implications in the lore are a bit chilling. They also look amazing and would make for an excellent desk figure--if we can play as one in a future BioShock 3 (maybe Eleanor herself?) I would be in heaven, but I'm not holding my breath.

I sure did a lot of glazing for giving this game an 8 (on Backloggd; 8.5 in my heart), but it's not all top tier. Enemy AI is still a bit basic yet highly accurate, with no way to avoid damage other than a drill upgrade much later and blasting through health packs. The controls are a tad dated, with the baffling decision to not include a pause menu to choose your weapons which the original had. And as I mentioned before, the plot itself is just fine; it fits well into the series, but there are no Frank Fontaine moments and "would you kindly" moments, save for maybe two: RIP Sinclair and Mark Meltzer.

There are also some minor but noticeable tweaks: instead of being a diegetic explanation of Plasmids ("light your cigarette! Charge a cable!") the little videos outright tell you to "damage enemies" and other game-y phrases. Minigun standard ammo is wayyyyy too plentiful and, in fact, ammo in general was a bit too easy to come by, even on the hardest difficulty.

But other than some of those issues, which are all comparatively minor, BioShock 2 is still an excellent game with a lowkey fun multiplayer mode that earns its title.

185387285.review:
Bioshock 2 feels more like a standalone expansion of the first game rather than a complete sequel when playing them back to back. I think the final result improves on the original in ways, but becomes less memorable in the process.

The gameplay is very similar, but improved. All the changes are welcome, I had much more fun with the combat of this one compared to the first. The levels are more exploration focused, or maybe I did more exploration since I was having fun killing all the enemies, idk. I pretty much rushed through the first but took my time with this one. I did miss having some boss battles though, especially the ending needed one.

There is still a lot of worldbuilding through voice logs and such, but the story has now become much more focused on a few characters that almost feel like caricatures, and even people from the first game suffer from this. I felt the political satire has become very shallow as well. 

The art direction has become more steampunk compared to the unique retro futuristic - art deco style of the original. I didn't like the direction they took. The level design is hit too, the levels are certainly more fun to play but they feel much more videogamey now, none of the locations really felt like what the designers were intending to create.

Worth a play, but it doesn't have anything interesting to say or show to you.

[h1] BioShock 2 Remastered: теперь ты папа, а не амнезия [/h1]

Добро пожаловать обратно в Восторг! Помните, как в первой части вы ломились по подводным коридорам, пытаясь понять, кто вы такой и что вообще здесь происходит? Забудьте. Теперь вы — Большой Папочка! Да, с дрелью, в шлеме и с вечным "почему моя жизнь такая сложная".

Сюжет? Эмоциональные качели. У вас есть "дочь" — Маленькая Сестричка, и вы готовы разворотить пол-Восторга, чтобы её спасти. Но не волнуйтесь, в вашем пути обязательно встретятся мутанты, философские монологи и Леди Лэмб, которая очень хочет вас убить.

Геймплей стал ещё веселее: у вас теперь две руки для тотального хаоса! В одной — плазмиды, в другой — оружие. Электрошок в одну сторону, дрель — в другую. И всё это с такой плавностью, что аж сердце радуется.

Моральные выборы снова на месте. Спасать Маленьких Сестричек или превратить их в... ну, скажем так, "полезные ресурсы"? Решайте сами, но помните, что Восторг всё видит.

Итог: ты папа, который решает проблемы с дрелью. Графика лучше, атмосфера всё ещё давит, а финал пробивает прямо в душу. Восторг снова рулит.

185233379.review:
A Deeper Dive into Rapture!
Returning to Rapture in Bioshock 2 feels like slipping back into a familiar yet eerily transformed dream. 
The underwater city remains as hauntingly beautiful as ever, but this time, you experience it through the eyes of a Big Daddy, a perspective that brings a whole new level of depth and emotional resonance to the story.
Playing as Subject Delta, one of the earliest Big Daddies, gives the gameplay a fresh and visceral edge. 
The iconic drill and rivet gun feel satisfyingly heavy, and the ability to dual-wield weapons and plasmids makes combat even smoother and more engaging than the original. 
The plasmid mechanics have also been refined, allowing for devastating combos and creative approaches to tackling enemies.
The heart of Bioshock 2 lies in its narrative, which shifts from the philosophy of free will in the first game to the complexities of family, sacrifice, and the bonds that tie us together. 
Eleanor Lamb, your Little Sister-turned-daughter figure, adds an emotional core to the story, while her mother, the ideologically driven Sofia Lamb, serves as a compelling and morally gray antagonist.
The moral choices surrounding the Little Sisters return, but with a new twist: you’re not just rescuing or harvesting them, you’re also protecting them during tense and challenging "gathering" sequences. 
These moments, where you defend the Little Sisters from waves of Splicers, are some of the most thrilling parts of the game and reinforce the bond between you and these vulnerable yet vital companions.
The environments in Bioshock 2 delve into new corners of Rapture, from abandoned amusement parks to crumbling undersea slums, each dripping with atmosphere and storytelling. 
The audio logs continue to flesh out the city’s tragic history. 
While it may not carry the same groundbreaking impact as the first game, Bioshock 2 stands tall as a worthy sequel that deepens the lore, refines the gameplay, and delivers a story with genuine emotional weight. 
For fans of Rapture, it’s a return trip well worth taking.

185189322.review:
[h1] Обзор на игру BioShock 2 [/h1]  

BioShock 2 — продолжение одной из самых известных игр в жанре шутеров с элементами RPG. Несмотря на попытки привнести новые идеи, игра не смогла повторить успех оригинала, но оставила после себя положительные впечатления.  

[h2] Плюсы игры [/h2]  
[list]  
[*] Улучшенная механика боя: возможность использовать два оружия одновременно и мощные силы делает сражения разнообразнее.  
[*] Развитие мира: узнаем больше о жизни в Раптюре и о его обитателях.  
[*] Сильный антагонист: лампы и атмосфера, создающие ощущение настоящей угрозы.  
[*] Кооперативный режим: возможность играть с друзьями добавляет разнообразия.  
[/list]  

[h2] Минусы игры [/h2]  
[list]  
[*] Менее интересный сюжет: история в продолжении не была столь захватывающей, как в первой части.  
[*] Заметное повторение механик: хотя игра улучшила многое, некоторые элементы кажутся схожими с оригиналом.  
[*] Нечеткая мотивация: действия главного героя не всегда понятны и не вызывает сильной привязанности.  
[/list]  

[h3] Заключение [/h3]  
BioShock 2 — это достойное продолжение, которое понравится поклонникам оригинала, но оно не смогло достичь той же глубины и оригинальности, как первая игра.

185179697.review:
本作是在一代时间线之后，主角是一台原型大老爹，感觉变成大老爹还挺有意思的。
还有可以操控小妹妹，通过小妹妹的视角来看销魂城。在小妹妹的视角之下销魂城居然是天堂，可以采集亚当物质的尸体居然是天使，还是挺讽刺的。
本作和一代很相似，味也很正，也是啥都不告诉你就把你丢进去，故事也很简单老套，但是即使故事并不复杂，其传达出的理念和人性的光辉仍然不会衰减。本作有多个结局，应该是随你有没有采集小妹妹来的，接近结尾的女儿也会受你的所作所为的影响去行事。
dlc的剧情有点出乎我的意料，居然是主角造的ai一直帮助主角找回自己，有种看了小小说的感觉。
还有后期的父女齐上阵，女儿还是挺强的。

185060239.review:
[b] BioShock 2 Remastered : Sujet Delta

°Introduction

Bioshock 2 Remastered est une version améliorée du jeu original, sorti en 2010. Ce titre se déroule dans la ville sous-marine de Rapture, huit ans après les événements de son prédécesseur. Le joueur incarne Subject Delta, un ancien Big Daddy, dans une quête pour retrouver sa petite sœur, Eleanor.

°Amélioration

Cette remasterisation propose des graphismes rehaussés, un éclairage amélioré et des textures de meilleure qualité. De plus, le jeu inclut des fonctionnalités modernes telles que des options de contrôle affinées et un support pour les résolutions élevées.

°Points Positifs

Graphismes : Les améliorations visuelles apportent une nouvelle vie à l'environnement de Rapture.
Narration : L'histoire captivante et les relations entre les personnages, notamment entre Delta et Eleanor, enrichissent l'expérience de jeu.
Bande-son : La musique et les effets sonores contribuent à l'atmosphère immersive.

°Points Négatifs

Équilibrage : Certains joueurs ont noté des problèmes d'équilibrage, notamment en ce qui concerne le son et la difficulté des ennemis.
Comparaison avec le premier opus : Bien que le jeu soit de qualité, il ne parvient pas à égaler l'impact émotionnel et l'innovation du premier Bioshock.

°Esthétique et Ambiance

L'esthétique de Bioshock 2 Remastered conserve l'atmosphère sombre et mystérieuse de Rapture, avec des éléments art déco. Cependant, certains critiques estiment que l'ambiance pourrait sembler moins immersive par rapport à l'original.

°Équilibrage

Des retours d'expérience indiquent que l'équilibrage audio et la difficulté des combats peuvent parfois nuire à l'expérience de jeu. Les ajustements dans ces domaines sont nécessaires pour une expérience optimale.

°Conclusion

En somme, Bioshock 2 Remastered est une réimagination réussie qui offre une expérience enrichie tout en préservant l'essence du jeu original. Bien qu'il présente quelques défauts, il demeure un titre incontournable pour les amateurs de la série et les nouveaux joueurs. [/b]

184820008.review:
It is not absolutely necessary to have played the first part to enjoy BioShock 2. However, knowing the background story of the city from the first game greatly enhances the atmosphere. The story of Rapture with its various facets is captivating. In both the first and second parts, the city is already in decline. The attempted utopia has failed, yet you can still see glimpses of the builder's vision and want to understand how it all came to this. This is primarily achieved through the clever use of audio diaries scattered throughout the city. These recordings, made by living or deceased residents, allow you to delve deeper into the story. The developers' decision to include a perspective shift from the first game, allowing you to play as a "Big Daddy," was an excellent addition.

Having played the game three times at different difficulty levels, I can say that the easiest setting allows you to focus on the story but can quickly become boring as enemies pose no real challenge. I would recommend at least playing on "Medium" difficulty. As you progress, you become more powerful through upgrades, but researching enemies thoroughly is still very helpful, especially in later stages. The "moral" choices are rather simplistic, following a black and white principle of being either a "good person" or "really mean and nasty." While lacking depth, this doesn't detract from the overall flow of the game and story.

The control scheme with mouse and keyboard is typical for a first-person shooter, enhanced by plasmid powers. In higher difficulties, these powers can be crucial in combat. Cycling through powers can be confusing in the heat of battle, but you get used to it quickly. Powers and weapons can be individually selected and swapped. A nice feature is the ability to purchase slots for these.

The graphics in the Remastered version have been polished, though the improvements are modest for PC players. If you're buying the game for the first time, you might as well go for the Remaster.
Regarding technical stability, the game crashed occasionally during my three playthroughs. This happens unexpectedly, with the game simply closing. Regular saving helps mitigate this issue. While it can break immersion, it shouldn't deter you from playing. Additional patches have significantly improved stability. In my last run, the game crashed only once, which is acceptable. I've played the game on both Windows and Linux (Mint), and it runs very well on both systems.

184818208.review:
Simply put being a Big Daddy is fun. It's a lot of fun.

Fighting in this game is a lot of fun. Being able to use plasmids and weapons at the same time is a nice change from the first game. I found each of the weapons to be fun to use, and I didn't find myself relying on one over the other at the start of the game. Of course upgrading the weapons to improve them will change things, but I never found any weapon that was 'the best' right out of the gate. 

You are free to upgrade whatever weapon you like, and I don't think there is any 'wrong answer' to how you go about upgrading. Want to get all of the upgrades for one specific weapon? Sure. Want to spread the upgrades out among all of the weapons? Go for it. I found all of the upgrades rather useful, so you are free to play around with it and try out whatever you like. 

I also found most of the plasmids rather useful. Of course there are some plasmids that I tend to gravitate toward whenever I play, but all the plasmids are useful and I always enjoyed trying them out. If you are a pretty creative person you can create some pretty chaotic but fun fights. 

Tonics are also a bit improved here in 2 over 1. Unlike in Bioshock 1 you aren't limited by what sort of tonics you can have, so you have a bit more freedom over what sort of build you can give yourself. If you want to use more combat related tonics you can, or if you would like to make hacking machines in the game easier and more useful for you that's also an option. Mix and match your tonics as you like till you find the combo that makes you happiest. 

Hacking in this game is also much easier. In Bioshock 1 hacking required doing a pipe puzzle that could be rather time consuming. Hacking in 2 is much quicker, and doesn't feel as tedious as the pipe puzzles from one did. 

I found the levels in this game to be fun places to explore, and I didn't find myself getting lost much. I found each level to be unique from each other, and I had fun searching every corner for things to collect. Unlike with 1 though once you leave a level you cannot go back once you leave, so make sure you did everything you wished to do in a level before you move on. The game makes sure to warn you of this as well, so this isn't something that they surprise you with. 

 Minerva's Den DLC for this game is a wonderful addition to the Bioshock series, and probably the best DLC for the game. It has an emotional little story with a cool twist. Also, the ion laser from this game is a whole lot of fun to use. The same can be said for a special little plasmid that you can only use in this dlc. I never got lost in Minerva's Den, and I love the lore building in this game. Minerva's Den is a must play for any Bioshock fan.

The Protector Trial is okay as a DLC, but not anything to write home about. If you like doing challenges this can be interesting since the challenges tend you force you to rely on a limited plasmid, tonic, and weapon load out. However, if you don't care for such things you might want to skip the Protector Trials DLC. The most interesting thing about the DLC is the concept art you can unlock, and the storyboard animation of things that were going to be used in the game but ended up being cut. Completing the challenges also nets you a rather useful tonic that can then be used in Minerva's Den DLC.   

With all that said I have the mention the one major downside of the Remaster. The Remaster crashes. It crashes a lot. When first playing the Remaster the game worked perfectly for me, but once I got to the Siren Alley level it started crashing often, and it never really improved. If you are going to play the Remaster I suggest saving often. For me the game tended to crash while collecting ADAM with a Little Sister, during a major fight against a boss, or when fighting a Big Sister. 

If you plan to suffer through the crashes I suggest saving before and after each ADAM gather and boss fight. The game does have a quick save, but the quick save does not save often so don't rely on it if you don't want to lose a good 20 or 30 minutes of progress. The crashing is pretty much the only thing that brings this otherwise wonderful game down, and admittedly the crashing is bad. Still, if you can get over the crashing or are lucky enough to not have to deal with crashing at all you will have a fun revisit to Rapture on your hands.

Пройшовши гру довго думав чи варто її рекомендувати. У таких ситуаціях я завжди звертаюсь до суб'єктивної оцінки - чи відчув я задоволення в кінці гри. І це скоршіе так, аніж ні.

Що хотів би виділити - порівняно з 1-ою чатсиною це крок назад і пів крока вперед. Чому? Ну тому що у першій грі все таки було видно що це копія System Shock. Друга частина вже навіть не намагається брати звідти механіки перетворившись просто у рельсовий шутер. Карти стали абсолютно лінійними, вороги залишилися ті ж самі, сюжет в принципі той же самий, тільки замість боротьби з капіталізмом ми боремося з більшовицькими замашками доктора Лем та рятуємо доньку. Різних локацій стало менше, а сюжет став менш епічним.

Чому ж рецензія позитивна? Ну насправді тому що автори зрозуміли що не можуть зробити хороший "імерсів сім", тому зробили просто міцненький шутанчік, який еволюціонує у кінематографічну третю частину. Якщо перша частина намагалася скопіювати все і одразу, то друга частина з сюжетом за 3 копійки абсолютно ненапряжний спинномозковий шутан. Механіки всі залишились з першої частини. Якщо б я не знав що це друга частина, то подумав би що це ДЛС, бо і вороги ті ж самі, ну окрім Великих Сестричок. Чомусь всю гру мені лізло порівняти його з Метро 2033, але Метро збереглося краще, плюс сюжет цікавіше.

І все таки мені було приємно пробігтися вулицями Рапче-сіті. Хоча це доволі посередня гра на зараз, та моя рекомендація буде лише для тих хто хоче пограти у франшизу/поностальгувати за шутерами нульових, у інших випадках я би пошукав щось інше.

PS: гра безбожно вилітає на нових системах, навіть з 9 діректіксом, і купою налаштувань  - відключенням антивіруса та джі форс контрола. Рекомендую зберігатися після кожного аудіолога чи серйозною битвою, щоб не перепроходити все заново.

Low-mid. It's not a patch on bioshock 1 or indeed infinite. Just a series of rooms that you have to kill things in. 
The weapons are not very good - surely a shotgun to someones face should murder them? Nope. The drill was something to be feared in bioshock 1, but in this game it's kinda weak and dull.  

I spent too much time trying to find money and ammo. The special powers are nothing special.

The story is confusing and best ignored, at least until the end when it starts to make some kind of sense (but not really). 

You play as a very weak big daddy. Covered in 3 inch thick steel, but can be killed by a couple of bullets. It's not difficult, just a bit tedious. 

Go here, random npcs arrive, shoot them, move forward. 

Please note, I had not a single crash in 29hrs of tedious gameplay.

It took me months to finish this game, again, not because it was difficult, but mainly because I could only stand to play it for half hour at a time. It just bored me to tears.

184668302.review: W BIOSHOCK 2 Remastered wpadasz w rolę dużego tatusia. Jest to znane tylko jako delta podmiotu i była pierwszym funkcjonalnym wielkim tatusiem, który jest teraz szybkim celem. Wiele lat później obudził go jego była młodsza siostra. W międzyczasie Sofia Lamb Rapture przejęła i sprawiła, że ​​celem było zniszczenie ludzkiego ego. Odtąd wędrujesz przez nieudaną utopię, aby uratować Eleanor, jego młodszą siostrę. Rapture jest nadal imponującym tłem, ale stracił tajemniczy czynnik. Znowu jest wielu audiologów z interesującymi monologami interesujących postaci, a ty przeżyjesz zapierającą dech w piersiach historię o wiązaniu wielkiego tatusia z jego młodszą siostrą. Ponadto staje się ekscytujący dzięki zwolennikowi Sofia Lambs, było wcześniej zachwycone chaosem, mieszkańcy są teraz zorganizowani i przypominają sektę. Nawet jeśli akcja nie osiągnie już wysokości pierwszej części, nigdy nie będziesz rozczarowany. Na szczęście system bojowy został ulepszony w właściwych miejscach, aby przedstawić dalszy rozwój. Wreszcie możesz jednocześnie używać broni i plazmidu, co sprawia, że ​​walki są znacznie szybsze i zabawniejsze. Jest to również konieczne, ponieważ jest więcej wrogów, którzy są teraz bardziej agresywni. Plazmidy również się rozwinęły, nawet jeśli na pierwszy rzut oka niekoniecznie jest to rozpoznawalne. Jednak przy wyrównywaniu uzupełniają się one teraz dodatkowe efekty, co oznacza, że ​​nie tylko stają się one bardziej skuteczne, ale oferują więcej opcji walki. Możesz umieścić pułapki, pokroić drony i walczyć z hordami wrogów w obszarach bojowych ze strategią.

Je viens de terminer un énième gameplay et j'ai eu peu de crashs en 15h de jeu, peut-être 3, le tout en widescreen 3440x1400 et fps capés à 144, donc pas une configuration très standard. 184477728.review:
I’m writing this negative review not because of the crashes (as many others have already discussed), though I personally only experienced one or two. Outside of the crashes, it’s clear a lot of people love BioShock 2. Unfortunately, I just can’t get into it.

Here’s why:

The combat feels off. Bullets often don’t seem to hit even when aimed correctly, and some enemies are frustratingly spongy despite weapon upgrades. The shooting mechanics feel clunky, and while there’s some variety of weapons and plasmids (superpowers), the game doesn’t encourage much creativity with them.

Environmental damage is also very limited, and the areas all start to feel the same after a while. Items are overpriced compared to what you can loot, leaving me constantly depleted. Most fights end up draining my resources, ammo, health, and EVE; forcing me to scour every corner just to stay afloat.

Upgrades feel underwhelming, too. Some improvements barely make a difference, I feel personally that every upgrade feels just like a 0.2 increase, which is insulting given how much ADAM they cost.

The story and gameplay, while not terrible, doesn’t hook me like the first game did. The characters and plot feel less compelling overall, and the pacing doesn’t keep me invested. There's a lack of depth and variety to, it feels repetitive. Defending little Sisters while gathering ADAM feels repetitive and grindy. Last point about that, the game doesn't feel creepy as the first one did.

At this point, I don’t think I’ll finish it. The constant struggle for survival, combined with repetitive environments and uninspiring upgrades, is draining my patience. It’s a shame because I really wanted to enjoy this sequel, but it’s just not working for me.

183672785.review:
BioShock 2 is an excellent FPS game and, in many ways, better than BioShock 1. If you liked BioShock 1, then you should play this as they fixed everything they could to improve the gameplay.  Just play the very fist 5min of the game... It was amazing for me. BioShock games like to hide the Truth. Just like in the first game, you will have some questions like What? Why? Who?...

Spoiler free small intro: We are a Big Daddy. Game takes place in 1968 which is after the BioShock 1 events. We are one of the first Big Daddies to have a little sister. This type of Big Daddies can only have one little sister, they share a huge bond. That is the reason we are going to find our lost little sister, Eleanor.

There are some new enemy types in the game, and they give a good amount of loot. Make sure to research them to increase the damage you deal. BioShock 2's researching machanism is way better than BioShock 1. It is very easy to fully research enemies, turrets, cameras and others.

We can adopt a little sisters after defeating the big daddy. Once adopted, you can gather ADAMS from 2 dead bodies. After that you can either harvest or rescue the little sister. BTW gathering ADAM is not easy. Rescue them if you want the good ending and You will still have enough ADAMS to buy tonic, plasmids, and slots. Every time you rescue or harvest 4 little sister you will have to face the hardest enemy in the game.

Tips:
i. Do not kill boss-type characters. They will not hurt you, so do NOT KILL them. That will change the game ending. Killing them and rescuing little sister will directly affect the ending of the game.
ii. You will not have to worry about ammo if you have researched enemies and used correct bullet type for the relevant enemy.
iii. Use Winter Blast plasmid and Rocket Spears to kill the hardest enemy in the game, It will save time and ammo.
iv. Use the tonic that restore Eve when you use a medikit as it is very useful when fighting a hard boss
v. Find all the Audio Diaries to fully understand the story and characters... this is optional, JUST DO IT.

My rating is 8/10 but should have been 9/10 as the plot, bgm and the world is phenominal. Why 8? Unlimited Game CRASHING problem. The game suffers from frequent crashing, which can be extremely frustrating, especially during intense fights or while gathering ADAM. I had to spam quick save during fights and every time i collect anything in game. Its been so much time, yet they have not fixed it. You will find so many old YT videos that show the way to fix this problem (but they did not help me). FIX THAT PROBLEM PLEASE. I don’t want to sugarcoat this, but it’s 100% a great game and could even be one of the best games in the world. Try it—you’ll like it a lot!

183546975.review: Not my favorite of the trilogy for many reasons but carries the spirit of the first game. It more feels like an expansion DLC for the first game rather than a standalone title. However that is not to say this game isn't great. The visuals in this series is unmatched and this game is no different. The story is really interesting and making choices with the little girls matter to getting a different ending just like the first. There are often visual and audio glitches even with the remaster. For example in certain parts of the game the audio cues just won't play or if you have the reverb option turned on, the reverb was just too much at times or too loud. Still this game is worth a shot when on sale and doesn't disappoint.
